attributes.action: Remove from the census all criteria which refers to colour as a means of description
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
In recognition of the Charter of Fundemental Rights - Article 23 which states that "Equality between men and women must be ensured in all areas, including employment, work and pay.", and the The Human Rights Act 1998, we oppose the current census categories and demand that people no longer be labled as colours but respected as human beings who have a particular nationality and ancestory.

For instance a person would no longer be Black-British but would instead be Brit-african Caribbean or Britafrican.

Without delay the census should adopt a framework similar to outlined below:

British Categories
Brit-
•	English
•	Irish
•	Scottish
•	Welsh
•	African
•	African-Caribbean
•	Asian

Non-British Categories
•	African
•	Asian
•	Caribbean
•	European (East)
•	European (West)
•	European (North)
•	European (South)
•	Other
